attributes.comment:
I've just learned that you are planning to make the requirements for the I600A
more expensive. Why is that? Already, fingerprinting through the USCIS costs
twice what it does at the local police station, for the exact same clearances. And
why make the application cost more? Are you aware of the costs associated with
international adoption? I looked into adopting through social services, but the
drama is at least as much as an international adoption, with no guarantees that a
child places with you will be a permanent arrangement. International adoption is
more of a "sure thing" than adopting here in the United States, but it is also very
expensive. Why make families take an additional hit in the bank account, or
delay children gaining a permanent family while parents scramble for more
money? The programs in China take quite some time, and most families have to
reapply for a second I600A while waiting for a referral. If you are going to raise the
fees, can't you at least make a lower cost option for renewing and expiring
clearance? Thank you for listening.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Karen B.
